metadata.title: CVE-2019-10082 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
In Apache HTTP Server 2.4.18-2.4.39, using fuzzed network input, the http/2session handling could be made to read memory after being freed, duringconnection shutdown.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-10082` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.10
apache2-bin - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.10
apache2-data - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.10
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.10
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.10
apache2-utils - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.10
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.29-1ubuntu4.10').
